DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure ERBB2 Gene Extracellular Domain Result Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the name of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood serum for HER2/neu, ERBB2 Gene at 17q21.1 encodes ERRB2 Receptor Protein Tyrosine Kinase, a 185 kD type I membrane glycoprotein that controls cell growth with features similar to EGFR, for the part of a transmembrane protein which projects into the environment surrounding a cell..

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure ERBB2 Gene Extracellular Domain Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood serum for HER2/neu, ERBB2 Gene at 17q21.1 encodes ERRB2 Receptor Protein Tyrosine Kinase, a 185 kD type I membrane glycoprotein that controls cell growth with features similar to EGFR, for the part of a transmembrane protein which projects into the environment surrounding a cell.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The ERBB2 Gene at 17q21.1 encodes ERRB2 Receptor Protein Tyrosine Kinase, a 185 kD type I membrane glycoprotein that controls cell growth with features similar to EGFR. Ligand binding increases phosphorylation of tyrosine residues. A potential heterodimer with ERBB3 and ERBB4 receptors, p185ERBB2 is an essential component of the heregulin/neuregulin receptor complex. ERBB2 homodimers do not bind heregulin but ERBB2/ERBB3 heterodimers do. Neuregulins do not interact with ERBB2 alone. The IL6 cytokine induces tyrosine phosphorylation of ERBB2 and ERBB3, but not EGFR. ERBB2 forms an IL6-dependent complex with the IL6R gp130 subunit resulting in MAPK activation. Expressed in fetal kidney and liver, herstatin is a 68 kD secreted product of an alternative ERBB2 transcript that retains intron 8. Herstatin binds p185ERBB2 as an inhibitor by disrupting ERBB2 dimers and reducing p185 tyrosine phosphorylation.  (from SWISS-PROT, OMIM and NCI):The part of a transmembrane protein which projects into the environment surrounding a cell.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in cellular proliferation and is involved in the oncogenic process through amplification and/or overexpression in several cancers.
Any part of a transmembrane protein that projects into the environment surrounding a cell.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the text field related to a lab result.
